title: Did Trump cross the line on Kashmir issue? | Explained

title: Minister Lokesh and his family meet PM Modi
content: Mr. Modi unveiled the first copy of the coffee table book Yuvagalam which chronicles the historic 3,132 km padayatra taken out by Mr. Lokesh in the run up to the 2024 elections

title: Civil society organisations demand judicial enquiry into Pahalgam terror attack in letter to PM Modi
content: Hate-mongering via media and social media, which fuels distrust and communalism, must be curbed immediately, the statement said

title: Govt. Taluk Hospital in Vaniyambadi inundated after heavy downpour
content: Municipal officials say the hospital is located in a low-lying area near Kannamapudur lake that is heavily encroached upon; its drains are small and built several years ago

title: Major reshuffle in Trinamool‚Äôs rank and file, two heavyweights replaced
content: The two organisational districts where the individual organisational district presidents have been replaced by core committees are Birbhum and Kolkata (Uttar), where the complaints of the organisational infighting had been the maximum.

title: T.N. will file case against the Centre in SC for withholding funds over language policy: Stalin
content: Releasing a book on the NEP, authored by Minister Anbil Mahesh Poyyamozhi, he says the funds rightfully belong to the State as recommended by the Parliamentary Standing Committee on Education, headed by former M.P. Chief Minister and Congress MP Digvijay Singh

title: Heavy rain in Bengaluru causes chaos, more showers expected till May 21
content: As per the IMD, parts of Karnataka are likely to witness heavy showers and thunderstorms on Sunday, with gusty winds reaching speeds of 40‚Äì50 kmph

title: Age concession for direct recruitment into¬†T.N. government service to remain till September 2026
content: In a recent communication, Chief Secretary N. Muruganandam clarified that the decision was a ‚Äúone-time concession‚Äù and added that this would be applicable only to recruitment by various agencies and appointing authorities

title:
Shift in ecosystem of¬†Parambikulam
forests through the eyes of tribes
content: In a seminar held as part of a government initiative, tribespeople have aired concerns regarding the disproportionate surge in peacock population as well as decline of the once-common hump-nosed vipers in the area

title: A tad more than what is necessary
content: The Comptroller Auditor-General‚Äôs report on higher education, which was tabled in the Assembly during the recent Budget session, advised the Directorate of Collegiate Education to ensure that self-financing colleges abide by its instructions on application fees. R. Sujatha takes a deep dive to figure out the reality in colleges in Tamil Nadu

title: Pakistan-linked ghost SIM card racket busted in Assam
content: A fraudulently acquired SIM card seized earlier was used to report the movement of Indian troops, says Director General of Police Harmeet Singh

title: Member states pledge troops and support to UN peace keeping missions in Berlin Ministerial
content: The Ministerial comes at a time when the world body is undergoing major internal restructuring, facing major funding cuts by the U.S. and Europe‚Äôs increased military spending.

title: All-party delegation to convey India‚Äôs united message against terrorism marred by partisan politics
content: Govt. ignores three of the four names suggested by Congress; party doesn‚Äôt nominate Shashi Tharoor to represent the party in the diplomatic delegation but government names him; party accuses Centre of ‚Äòplaying games‚Äô

content: On scanning the QR code on the card from a mobile phone, the APSDMA website comes up with real-time temperature in a location presented in a colour-coded box

title: India curbs Bangladeshi exports via land ports
content: Ready-made garments from Bangladesh will be allowed to enter India only through the ports of Kolkata and Mumbai where the cargo shipments will be subjected to ‚Äòmandated inspections‚Äô

title: Sangh Parivar-backed trade union boycotts SCO meet on labour issues, faces flak
content: The meeting was organised by the All China Federation of Trade Unions. Leaders of other CTUs, such as All India Trade Union Congress (AITUC) and the Centre of Indian Trade Unions (CITU) have attended the meeting.

title: Pakistan continues using Chinese drones to drop narcotics and arms along Punjab border, BSF data shows
content: Multiple consignments of explosives, weapons, and heroin were recovered by security forces almost daily since the May 10 agreement to halt military actions.

title: States without protection for inter-faith, inter-caste couples in contempt of SC: Mihir Desai
content: Renowned rights lawyer calls for national legislation; credits Bombay HC‚Äôs intervention for Maharashtra‚Äôs SOPs on safeguarding couples

title: BSF South Bengal Frontier foils gold smuggling attempt, appeals for public help
content: Two smugglers caught with over 1 kg of gold worth ‚Çπ1.11 crore at North 24 Parganas border; BSF urges citizens to report smuggling via helpline

title: Cop Jumps Into Ghaziabad Canal In Bid To Save Woman From Alleged Suicide, Dies
content: A traffic police constable died on Saturday after he jumped into the Hindon Canal to save a woman who was allegedly attempting suicide, officials said.

title: In Centre's Anti-Terror Outreach Teams, Only 1 Name Suggested By Congress
content: The Centre has released the final list of seven all-party delegations that will travel around the world to brief other nations about India's Operation Sindoor. From the Congress party's formal recommendation of four names, only Anand Sharma appeared.

title: iPhone Shipments Likely To Begin In June From Foxconn's Bengaluru Unit
content: Taiwanese electronics manufacturing major Foxconn's facility in Bengaluru is nearly ready for launch, with commercial iPhone shipments expected to begin as early as June, Karnataka Minister for Commerce and Industries, MB Patil, said on Saturday.

title: Video: Man Takes Down Signboard Stuck On High-Tension Wire In Noida
content: An iron signboard was dangling mid-air from a high tension wire, showed a video, as heavy rain and strong winds buffeted Uttar Pradesh's Noida on Saturday.

title: E-Rickshaw Driver Drugs, Rapes 25-Year-Old Woman In Delhi, Arrested: Cops
content: A 25-year-old woman was allegedly drugged, raped and robbed by an e-rickshaw driver in delhi, police said on Thursday.

title: Bumble CEO Lidiane Jones Resigns, Founder To Take On Role Of Chief Executive
content: Dating app operator Bumble said on Friday its founder and executive chair, Whitney Wolfe Herd, will become the chief executive of the company from mid-March after Lidiane Jones resigned as CEO.

title: Menendez Brothers Case Reflects Shifting Culture Across Decades
content: The trials of Lyle and Erik Menendez came at a time of cultural obsession with courts, crime and murder, when live televised trials captivated a national audience.

title: AAP Appoints Punjab Minister Aman Arora As New President Of Its State Unit
content: The ruling Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) in Punjab appointed New and Renewable Energy Minister Aman Arora as the new president of its state unit on Friday.

title: After Rahul Gandhi's 'Pak Informed' Post, Centre's 'Early Phase' Reply
content: Slamming Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi for his claim that informing Pakistan at the start of Operation Sindoor was a "crime", the BJP has accused him of spreading fake news.

title: 'Felt Vibration Of Tornado': 23 Dead Across US Amid Harsh Weather Conditions
content: Storm systems sweeping across parts of the U.S. Midwest and South have left at least 23 people dead, many of them in Kentucky, where what appeared to be a devastating tornado crumbled buildings and flipped over a car on an interstate.

title: 'Will Go To Supreme Court': MK Stalin To Centre Over Education Funds Row
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M K Stalin on Saturday slammed the BJP-led Centre, alleging it halted education funds to the state for its "petty politics."

title: "If I Have To Choose Between Hell And Pakistan...": Javed Akhtar
content: In strong comments after the recent hostilities between India and Pakistan, lyricist and scriptwriter Javed Akhtar has said that if his only two choices are between going to hell and the neighbouring country, he would choose hell.

title: World Is Praising Indian Army, PM Modi's Firm Resolve: Amit Shah On Op Sindoor
content: This was the first time since independence that Indian armed forces struck 100 km inside Pakistan, delivering a befitting response to terrorists, said Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday, as he praised 'Operation Sindoor'.

title: Over 30 Shanties Burnt In Fire At Slum Area In Gurugram Sector 52
content: A massive fire burnt more than 30 shanties in a slum area near the Wazirabad village on Saturday afternoon, officials said.

title: Mumbai Police Receive Hoax Bomb Threat To Blow Up Airport, Taj Hotel
content: Mumbai Police received an email threatening to blow up the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport in the city and Hotel Taj Mahal Palace with a bomb but it turned out to be a hoax, an official said on Saturday.

title: "Surge Of Emotions": BJP MLA After 'UN Order On India-Pak Ceasefire' Remark
content: An MLA of the ruling BJP in Madhya Pradesh on Saturday said the military strikes against Pakistan were stopped because of an "order" from the United Nations.

title: Lufthansa Plane Flew On Autopilot For 10 Minutes After Pilot Fainted: Report
content: A Lufthansa flight to Spain last year went without a pilot for 10 minutes after the co-pilot fainted while he was alone in the cockpit, German news agency dpa reported on Saturday.

title: India Imposes Port Curbs On Import Of Certain Bangladeshi Goods
content: India on Saturday imposed port restrictions on the import of certain goods, such as readymade garments and processed food items, from Bangladesh.

title: Roof Collapses At Delhi's New Ashok Nagar Station Amid Heavy Rain, Services Halted
content: A section of the steel roof at New Ashok Nagar station on the Delhi-Ghaziabad-Meerut RRTS corridor was damaged due to heavy rainfall accompanied by a strong windstorm on Saturday, an official statement.

title: "World Listens To Language Of Love Only When You Have Power": RSS Chief
content: While India is resolutely committed to global harmony and welfare, the world has now seen the country's formidable strength, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said on Saturday.

title: Brand Bengaluru Committee to propose creating multiple municipal corporations under GBA
content: The committee, chaired by B.S. Patil, held its first formal meeting on Saturday since the Act‚Äôs notification and began working on restructuring plans.

title: Bengaluru start-up develops ‚ÄòPapchup‚Äô, a papaya ketchup
content: Unlike many tomato ketchups, which have around 12%‚Äì18% tomato paste, Papchup has 50% papaya pulp; product will help papaya farmers get better prices for their crop, say the developers

title: Sajjala calls upon leaders to strengthen YSRCP for future elections¬†
content: Party committees will be formed at various levels with the aim of enrolling 18 lakh members by the end of the year, says the YSRCP State coordinator

title: 20 Maoists arrested, arms and ammunition seized in Mulugu district
content: They were apprehended during separate vehicle checking and search operations at different places under Venkatapuram, Wazeedu and Kannaigudem police station limits on Friday and Saturday, the police said

title: J&K to employ Ex-Servicemen for guard duties
content: Proposal will see 435 of the ESM, who carry licensed personal weapons, deployed across all 20 districts for non-combatant static guard duties.

content: Harish Kumar Gupta takes part in ‚ÄòSwarnandhra ‚Äì Swachh Andhra‚Äô drive at the State Police Headquarters at Mangalagiri

title: Killer tiger caught on camera
content: Search to continue for the tiger that mauled to death a man at Kalikavu after the animal evaded the forest team.

title: Rajasthan finalises action plan for M-sand plot auctions to curb illegal mining
content: Policy push aims to promote manufactured sand as alternative to riverbed sand, ease supply constraints, and ensure environmental compliance

content: The Congress leader‚Äôs claims were ‚Äòutter misrepresentation of facts‚Äô, the Ministry of External Affairs said

title: Free bus travel for women in Andhra Pradesh from August 15, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: It is one of the Super Six promises made by the TDP in the run-up to the elections; rolling out welfare schemes and attracting investments are the government‚Äôs twin priorities, he says

content: There has been a noticeable increase in the number of women visiting religious and tourist destinations across the district

content: According to eyewitnesses, the fire spread so fast that people did not even get a chance to take out their belongings from the shanties.

title: BRS MLAs demand roll back of Metro fare hike
content: Address an open letter to CM Revanth Reddy cautioning about people‚Äôs backlash if fare hike is not reversed

title: Repeat sexual predator sentenced 25 years of RI within 55 days of complaint in Odisha
content: This case is a powerful example of what proactive policing, scientific evidence gathering, and time-bound prosecution can achieve, says Jharsuguda SP

title: Nobel laureate Abhijit Banerjee to join TelanganaRising advisory board
content: The Nobel laureate spoke of the need to create unique short-term courses in traditional skills with modern design and appeal, marketing and the use of social media technology to help traditional artisans turn into modern entrepreneurs

title: Superstitions becoming widespread in society, says Pinarayi
content: Many national grants supporting research and higher education have now been removed or reduced, says Kerala Chief Minister

title: West Bengal official suspended for ‚Äòtampering‚Äô with electoral application forms
content: According to a notification by the Chief Electoral Officer, the accused misused an electoral official‚Äôs login credentials to allegedly dispose of certain application forms

title: Ten districts get new District Coordinators of Health Services
content: The move follows the Minister for Health, Medical Education and Family Welfare Y. Satya Kumar Yadav expressing concern over underperformance of a few officials

title: Police resort to lathi charge following tension at procession in Madanapalle
content: Situation turned tense when the rally reportedly took a diversion from the permitted route map and proceeded towards another direction, leading to objections from another group

title: Courts are not outside the ambit of the RTI Act: State Information Commission
content: Observing that officials of some subordinate courts are denying all information sought under the RTI Act, State Information Commissioner A. Abdul Hakkim says only judicial proceedings are exempted from disclosure under the Act

title: Tourist arrivals at all-time high in Idukki: Riyas
content: Tourism Minister virtually inaugurates the Kudiyetta Smarakam museum and District Tourism Promotion Council‚Äòs  photo frames project

title: Citizens come together for patriotic Tiranga rally on Hussainsagar
content: Starting from Ambedkar statue, the Tricolour rally ended near M-47 Patton Tank that was captured from a defeated Pakistan army during the 1971 war.

title: Gold merchants‚Äô unions trade charges over ‚Äòfund collection‚Äô for Messi‚Äôs visit
content: One group says ‚Çπ10,000 was collected from gold and silver merchants by the rival group to fund Messi‚Äôs visit to State, the latter denies charges

title: Tiruchi Corporation steps up water safety measures
content: Health officials are engaged in inspecting the water supply network, collecting water samples, chlorinating the water, and monitoring the chlorine level

title: Ramakanth Joshi of Manohara Granthamala is dead
content: He had been leading Manohara Granthamala since 1993 after the death of his father, the noted writer G.B. Joshi

title: Once a painful form of self-protection, tattooed faces are now rare among women in Kandhamal
content: In this remote Odisha district, tribal women once tattooed their faces to appear less attractive ‚Äî a painful tradition born out of resistance to sexual exploitation by landlords, royals, and British colonial rulers

title: Conduct inquiry regarding power outage at NEET examination centre, HC directs NTA
content: Passes the order on a writ petition filed jointly by 13 students who sought re-examination for all affected students

title: Telangana CM launches two programmes to support existing women-led enterprises, cultivate innovation among youth¬†
content: The Women Acceleration Programme aims to strengthen the capabilities of women entrepreneurs to scale sustainably and enhance their competitiveness, CEO of WE Hub explained

title: Karandlaje calls on woman, SC/ST entrepreneurs to use reservation
content: Union Minister of State for Labour and Employment, Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises Shobha Karandlaje has called on the woman entrepreneurs and those from SC/ST communities to avail the 3% reservation given to them in supply of spare parts to public sector undertakings (PSUs) of union government.

title: Sources: Celts' Brown has partial meniscus tear
content: Celtics star Jaylen Brown finished the season with a partially torn right meniscus and will be evaluated this coming week to determine if surgery is needed, sources told ESPN.

title: Clark: Flagrant foul on Reese a 'basketball play'
content: The Caitlin Clark-Angel Reese rivalry added another chapter Saturday when Reese took exception to Clark's hard foul with 4:38 left in the third quarter as the Fever and Sky opened their seasons.

title: Scuffling O's fire manager Hyde after slow start
content: The Orioles fired manager Brandon Hyde, hoping a new leader can spark a turnaround of the most disappointing team in Major League Baseball.

title: Scheifele uncertain for G6 after death of father
content: Mark Scheifele's father unexpectedly died Friday night, leaving the availability of the Jets' star forward in doubt for Saturday's Game 6 against the Stars.

title: Antonio Brown briefly detained at boxing event
content: Antonio Brown was briefly detained by police early Saturday following an altercation in which gunshots were fired outside a celebrity boxing event in Miami.

title: Pep: 'Don't know' why Haaland didn't take pen
content: Pep Guardiola admitted he thought Erling Haaland would take Manchester City's penalty during their FA Cup final defeat to Crystal Palace and revealed it was "decided on the pitch" that Omar Marmoush would step up before his miss.

title: Eichel, Knights seek 'common ground' on new deal
content: Vegas star Jack Eichel, with one season left on his eight-year, $80 million contract, is eligible for an extension on July 1, and Golden Knights general manager Kelly McCrimmon says that next deal is "a really important piece of business" for his club.

title: Italy's Paolini puts away Gauff to win Rome title
content: Jasmine Paolini put away Coco Gauff in straight sets to become the first Italian woman to win the Rome title in 40 years.

title: üí∞49ers' Brock Purdy is no longer Mr. Irrelevant
content: San Francisco has long benefited from the league's best bargain contract. Now, it's on Purdy to deliver results.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Who wins Game 6 of Stars-Jets?
content: It's win or go home for Winnipeg as Dallas eyes the conference finals. Here are the keys to the showdown.

title: UFC Fight Night: Does Burns have a best path to ending Morales' unbeaten run?
content: Who has the edge in this week's UFC Fight Night? An MMA coach and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Nothing is impossible: Crystal Palace's first FA Cup win over Man City proves that
content: Crystal Palace win their first major trophy in 120 years by winning the FA Cup, while a possible rebuild for Manchester City becomes more evident.

title: How Boston avoids breaking up its roster, plus offseason guides for every NBA team
content: NBA front office insider Bobby Marks breaks down the summer priorities and needs for every eliminated team.

title: Henderson on avoiding red card: 'Who cares?'
content: Crystal Palace goalkeeper Dean Henderson said, "Who cares?" and insisted he knew he would save Omar Marmoush's penalty after an FA Cup final red card reprieve.

title: USMNT's Richards: FA Cup win means world to me
content: Alabama-native Chris Richards hailed his unlikely journey to becoming just the second American to play in and win an FA Cup final on Saturday.

title: Madrid confirm Huijsen signing; to play in CWC
content: Real Madrid have completed the signing of Bournemouth defender Dean Huijsen, the LaLiga club have confirmed.

title: Leverkusen set record with Alonso set to depart
content: Bayer Leverkusen came from a goal down to rescue a 2-2 draw at hosts Mainz 05 in the Bundesliga finale on Saturday and hand departing coach Xabi Alonso another record as they went two league seasons without an away defeat.

title: Gy√∂keres leads Sporting to title with 39th goal
content: Star striker Viktor Gy√∂keres helped to lead Sporting CP to their second consecutive Portuguese league title after Benfica was held off on the final day of the season on Saturday.

title: Fastest to 25: Chawinga sets NWSL scoring record
content: Temwa Chawinga's goal on Friday night secured a 1-0 win for the Kansas City Current against the Orlando Pride, making her the quickest player in NWSL history to reach 25 goals.

title: How Alexis DeBoer has made a name for herself with Washington softball
content: While her famous dad went to Alabama to coach the Tide, Alexis DeBoer followed her dream to play for the Huskies.

title: A'ja Wilson leads WNBA's best dressed on opening weekend
content: Before the WNBA's best take the floor, they dazzled the pregame tunnel with their opening-night outfits.

title: Who are the best coaches in college football? We rank the top 10
content: Kirby Smart has to be No. 1, or does he? What about Ryan Day? Or Marcus Freeman? Who made our list -- and why.

title: Derek Carr retired, then an avalanche of unanswered questions followed
content: Derek Carr surprisingly announced his retirement on May 10. The decision -- and the timing -- has insiders throughout the league talking.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Gu√©hi could hold out for free move to Barcelona, Real Madrid
content: Marc Gu√©hi could run down his contract at Crystal Palace and move to Barcelona or Real Madrid on a free transfer. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Welcome to Banditland: Buffalo eyeing an NLL championship three-peat
content: The Bandits are on the verge of history, while star Dhane Smith is also chasing down an all-time record -- owned by his coach.

title: CM congratulates C.V. Anand
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the latest news is from the world of cinema and streaming . a weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in .

title: Sharif admits Nur Khan base was struck: ‚ÄòMunir rang me up at 2.30am‚Äô
content: Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has formally acknowledged that India conducted missile strikes on the Nur Khan airbase in Rawalpindi on May 9-10. This admission contradicts previous Pakistani statements that downplayed the extent of the damage. BJP leaders have asserted that Sharif's words confirm the scale and precision of Operation Sindoor.

title: In a 1st, we destroyed terror camps 100km inside Pakistan: Amit Shah
content: Amit Shah stated that India retaliated strongly after the Pahalgam terror attack. Indian forces destroyed terror camps inside Pakistan. This action demonstrated India's firm response to terrorism. Shah highlighted previous responses to Uri and Pulwama attacks. He mentioned the destruction of terrorist training camps. According to Shah, India's armed forces eliminated nearly 100 terrorists.

title: With Op Sindoor still on, military gets emergency purchase powers
content: Amidst tensions with Pakistan and a strategic pause in Operation Sindoor, India has granted its armed forces emergency procurement powers with a budget of approximately Rs 40,000 crore. This move allows the Army, IAF, and Navy to quickly replenish arms stockpiles and acquire advanced weaponry like missiles, drones, and precision-guided munitions.

title: 'Felt like bomb went off': Huge explosion rocks Palm Springs, 1 killed
content: A powerful explosion rocked Palm Springs, California, on Saturday morning, resulting in one fatality and prompting a large-scale emergency response. The blast, which occurred near North Indian Canyon Drive and East Tachevah Drive, led to the deployment of ATF investigators.

title: Indian-origin man slammed for calling to send H-1B holders back
content: An Indian-origin man in the US, Rohit Joy, sparked controversy by suggesting the termination of the H-1B visa program and the return of its holders to their home countries. This proposal came in response to Congressman Dr. Rich McCormick's advocacy for domestic visa renewals.

title: Delhi HC orders CBI & forensic probe into JEE Mains score ‚Äòmismatch‚Äô
content: The Delhi High Court has ordered a CBI probe, including a forensic examination, into alleged manipulation of JEE (Mains) 2025 scorecards following claims of discrepancies by two candidates. The court directed the Central Forensic Science Laboratory (CFSL) to expedite the inquiry and submit findings by May 22, ahead of the JEE (Advanced) 2025 results.

title: Cong livid as govt ignores its list for foreign outreach, picks Tharoor
content: A controversy has erupted after the Indian government selected Shashi Tharoor to lead a delegation on 'Operation Sindoor', despite Congress's disapproval and alternative recommendations. This decision has ignited accusations of political maneuvering and disregard for party preferences. The situation highlights a growing rift between Tharoor and Congress, potentially leading to a critical juncture in their relationship amid upcoming elections.

title: MEA refutes Rahul Gandhi claim EAM ‚Äòinformed‚Äô Pakistan about strikes
content: MEA strongly refuted Rahul Gandhi's allegation that Jaishankar informed Pakistan about Operation Sindoor, labeling it an "utter misrepresentation of facts." The MEA clarified that Pakistan was warned after the operation's commencement, not before. PIB's Fact Check Unit also debunked the claim, stating the EAM's remarks were selectively edited to mislead.

title: How Jyoti Malhotra passed secret information to Pakistan: Apps used and more
content: Indian YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra, known for her "Travel with JO" channel, has been arrested in Hisar on suspicion of spying for Pakistan. Police allege Malhotra shared sensitive information with Pakistani intelligence operatives via WhatsApp, Telegram, and Snapchat. Officials claim her actions violate the Official Secrets Act and pose a national security threat.

title: Op Sindoor: Azad, Akbar, Anand Sharma also on foreign outreach teams
content: India is launching 'Operation Sindoor,' sending seven all-party delegations to key nations worldwide to reinforce its commitment to combating terrorism. Fifty-one political leaders, including parliamentarians and former ministers from various parties, will participate in these delegations, each assisted by former diplomats. The initiative aims to convey a unified message of India's resolve against terrorism on a global scale.

title: At 1.5 lakh, pedestrians made up 20% of road deaths in 5 years
content: Nearly 1.5 lakh pedestrians died in India from 2019-2023, highlighting their vulnerability despite having right-of-way. A Supreme Court panel audit revealed that footpath availability varies widely across states, often not meeting standards. The court emphasized pedestrians' rights under Article 21, advocating for accessible, encroachment-free footpaths as a crucial, low-cost safety measure.

title: 4,000 ex-troops to guard vital infrastructure across J&K
content: The J&K government has approved deploying 4,000 ex-servicemen to protect vital infrastructure across the Union territory. These veterans will perform non-combatant duties, including static guard duties and local coordination, at power stations, bridges, and government installations. Around 435 personnel possess licensed weapons, enhancing their ability to respond to localized security situations.

title: Bill Gates on Zuckerberg's plan to give away his wealth: There are people like ...
content: Bill Gates has praised Mark Zuckerberg's commitment to donate 90% of his wealth through the Chan-Zuckerberg Initiative, highlighting Zuckerberg as a key figure in the next generation of philanthropists. Gates himself plans to donate 99% of his wealth to the Gates Foundation within 20 years, emphasizing the growing trend of tech entrepreneurs engaging in significant charitable giving.

title: Gujarat minister‚Äôs son held in Rs 71 crore MGNREGS scam case
content: Balwant Khabad, son of Gujarat minister Bachu Khabad, has been arrested in connection with a Rs 71 crore MGNREGS scam in Dahod. He and his brother are linked to firms that received undue payments for NREGA projects. The scam involved 32 firms and inflated projects, prompting calls for a special investigation team.

title: SC bars Centre from granting retrospective green clearances
content: The Supreme Court has affirmed that the right to a pollution-free environment is a fundamental right, invalidating a central government memorandum that permitted retrospective environmental clearances for projects violating established norms. The court strongly criticized the government's attempt to circumvent the law, emphasizing the constitutional obligation to protect the environment.

title: Massive search op launched in J&K‚Äôs Samba to trace 3 terror suspects
content: Security forces have initiated a joint search operation in the Samba district of Jammu and Kashmir. This action follows reports of suspected terrorist movement in the forest area. Police and central armed forces are combing Nangal, Chilladanga and Goran. Locals reported suspicious activity. Similar search operations were conducted recently in Reasi and Samba districts based on similar reports.

title: J&K CM, LG call for peace as India prepares to send all-party team abroad
content: Following Operation Sindoor and heightened tensions, J&K CM Omar Abdullah and LG Manoj Sinha affirmed India's dedication to peace while defending military actions against Pakistan-backed terrorism. India is preparing to dispatch an all-party parliamentary delegation abroad to articulate its position. Sinha highlighted Pakistan's request for mediation after Indian forces struck terrorist camps, emphasizing India's focus on development and peace.

title: Vyapam: 4 MBBS candidates among 10 given 3 years' rigorous imprisonment
content: A Bhopal CBI court has sentenced ten individuals, including four candidates, to three years in jail for fraudulent MBBS admissions via the PMT-2009 Vyapam exam. The convicted include candidates, impersonators, and a middleman, all fined Rs 16,000. The case, initially registered in 2015, was taken over by the CBI following Supreme Court directives, revealing widespread irregularities in MBBS admissions.

title: 22 kids among 90 from Bangladesh held in Mathura
content: In Mathura, authorities detained 90 Bangladeshi nationals, including children, for allegedly residing illegally in India, seizing documents and mobile phones. They were found working at brickyards, having crossed borders years ago. Simultaneously, Uttarakhand police arrested a US citizen and a Bangladeshi woman for lacking valid residency documents, highlighting ongoing efforts to address illegal immigration.

title: Madras HC stays NEET-2025 results over power cut row
content: Madras High Court has put a hold on the NEET-2025 results. This follows petitions from 13 candidates. They claim a power cut at an Avadi exam center near Chennai disrupted their test. Justice V Lakshminarayanan has asked the National Testing Agency to respond by June 2. Students faced issues like poor lighting and rainwater.

title: 23 'subversive elements' booked under PSA in Srinagar
content: Jammu and Kashmir Police have detained 23 individuals in Srinagar under the Public Safety Act, citing threats to national security and public order. These individuals, labeled as terror associates and miscreants, have been moved to district jails in Poonch, Udhampur, and Kot Balwal Jammu.

title: Alex Ovechkin set to return for 21st NHL season
content: Alex Ovechkin returns for his 21st NHL season with the Washington Capitals, chasing more records as he nears 40. Despite uncertainty about retirement, Ovechkin remains a dominant force, inspiring teammates and fans alike. With his historic goal-scoring legacy and leadership, the Capitals look to him to push for another Stanley Cup, proving age is just a number in hockey greatness.

title: Rain washes out IPL 2025 restart; KKR knocked out of playoff race
content: Persistent rain in Bengaluru led to the abandonment of the highly anticipated match between Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Kolkata Knight Riders, dashing KKR's playoff hopes. RCB, however, gained a point, boosting their position at the top of the table and virtually securing their playoff berth. The washout disappointed fans eager to celebrate Virat Kohli's Test retirement.

title: India curbs Bangladeshi consumer goods entry via Northeast
content: India has imposed restrictions on the import of several consumer goods from Bangladesh via land transit points in the northeast, impacting trade routes through Assam, Meghalaya, Mizoram, Tripura, and West Bengal. Ready-made garments will now only be allowed through Kolkata and Nhava Sheva sea ports.

title: What is emergency defence procurement? India okays Rs 40k cr for military buy
content: Amidst Operation Sindoor, Indian defence forces are set for emergency purchases worth Rs 40,000 crore to bolster combat readiness. The approved spending prioritises critical equipment like surveillance and kamikaze drones, missiles, and ammunition. Emergency powers expedite procurement, ensuring timely delivery within 3-6 months. Indian firms, including Bharat Electronics, are expected to receive orders.

title: IPL 2025 Points Table: Latest standings after RCB vs KKR match
content: Persistent rain in Bengaluru led to the cancellation of the RCB vs KKR match in the IPL 2025, eliminating KKR from playoff contention. RCB benefited from the shared points, climbing to the top of the standings. The playoff race remains tight, with several teams still mathematically in contention as no team has officially sealed a berth yet.

title: First trophy in 120 years! Crystal Palace stun Man City to win FA Cup title
content: Crystal Palace stunned Manchester City with a 1-0 victory in the FA Cup final, securing their first major trophy in 120 years. Eberechi Eze's stunning volley and Dean Henderson's heroic goalkeeping, including a penalty save, sealed the win. City's disappointing season ended trophyless as Palace's tactical setup and counterattacks proved too strong, raising questions about City's future direction.

title: Watch: White pigeons pay tribute to Kohli as rain halts IPL clash
content: A rain delay marred the anticipated IPL 2025 match between Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Kolkata Knight Riders at M. Chinnaswamy Stadium. Amidst the gloom, a flock of pigeons honored Virat Kohli's red-ball career. RCB aims to secure a playoff spot with a win, while KKR faces a must-win situation to stay in contention. Fans remain hopeful for a shortened match.

title: Virat Kohli in County Cricket? Middlesex hope to lure the Indian star
content: Middlesex is reportedly keen on signing Virat Kohli for a stint at Lord's, aiming to add the Indian superstar to their roster. Despite his Test retirement, Kohli hasn't ruled out first-class cricket, opening the door for a potential County Championship or One-Day Cup appearance.

title: Who is Jyoti Malhotra, YouTuber arrested for spying for Pakistan
content: Jyoti Malhotra, a travel vlogger from Haryana, has been arrested. She is accused of sharing sensitive information with Pakistani intelligence operatives. Malhotra, known as ‚ÄúTravel with Jo,‚Äù allegedly contacted Pakistani officials through messaging apps. Authorities claim her actions violated the Official Secrets Act. She is accused of posing a threat to national security. Investigations are currently underway.

title: Spain set to face Argentina in 2026 Finalissima as FIFA announces late-March window
content: Football fans, mark your calendars! Spain, the Euro champions, will face Lionel Messi's Argentina, the Copa Am√©rica victors, in the Finalissima 2026. FIFA has tentatively scheduled the match for late March 2026 in Mexico City, pending security approval. This clash of titans serves as a thrilling prelude to the expanded 2026 World Cup and could be Messi's last intercontinental appearance.

title: How India used 'dummy pilotless aircraft' during counter-strikes on Pak airbases
content: On May 9-10, the Indian Air Force decimated 11 Pakistani airbases in retaliation for attacks on 26 Indian locations following "Operation Sindoor." India's air defenses successfully countered Pakistan's initial strikes. The IAF employed dummy aircraft, loitering munitions, and long-range missiles like BrahMos and Scalp, crippling Pakistan's air defense and forcing a DGMO-level ceasefire agreement.

title: India seeks peace, but has strength to teach lesson: RSS chief on Op Sindoor
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat asserted that India is dedicated to global peace but possesses the strength to retaliate if provoked. He highlighted India's commitment to global welfare, emphasising that the world respects strength. Bhagwat cited India's assistance to Sri Lanka, Nepal, and the Maldives during crises, underscoring the nation's dedication to helping others despite occasional challenges.

title: RCB vs KKR: What is the cut-off time for a 5-over game?
content: Persistent rain has delayed the toss for the crucial IPL 2025 match between Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Kolkata Knight Riders at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium. RCB needs a win to secure a playoff spot, while KKR's playoff hopes hinge on winning their remaining matches. The game marks the return of IPL after a brief suspension.

title: Watch: Horrific! Tsunoda's F1 car in pieces after shocking crash
content: Yuki Tsunoda experienced a high-speed crash during the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix qualifying, losing control at Variante Villeneuve and colliding with the barriers at 240kph. The session was red-flagged as Tsunoda emerged unharmed, prompting concern from other drivers. This incident served as a stark reminder of the circuit's dangers, reminiscent of the fatal accidents in 1994.

title: Why Pakistan's Arshad didn't compete against Neeraj at Doha DL
content: Neeraj Chopra showcased his prowess at the Doha Diamond League, achieving a personal best of 90.23m, though finishing second to Julian Weber. Arshad Nadeem, however, was absent, strategically focusing on preparations for the upcoming Asian Athletics Championships in Gumi. Chopra's performance, guided by coach Jan Zelezny, signals strong momentum heading into the World Championships in Tokyo.

title: More iPhones from India soon amid Trump‚Äôs warning to Apple
content: Foxconn is poised to begin iPhone shipments from its Karnataka facility in June, aiming to make it their second-largest iPhone manufacturing hub after China. Despite pressure from Donald Trump to manufacture in the US, Apple seems to be proceeding with its India expansion plans.

title: 'Centre chose ...': Tharoor on Cong not naming him for all-party delegation
content: Shashi Tharoor addressed his inclusion in an all-party delegation despite not being nominated by the Congress, stating the government chose who they deemed fit. He affirmed his commitment to the role, dismissing political undertones. This situation sparked reactions, with Congress leaders making veiled criticisms and the BJP questioning the Congress's motives for excluding Tharoor.

title: Setback in Delhi as 13 councillors quit AAP, float new party
content: In a setback for the Aam Aadmi Party, 13 MCD councillors resigned, forming the Indraprastha Vikas Party, citing lack of development and internal strife. Led by Mukesh Goyal, the new party will focus on municipal issues. AAP alleges BJP induced the defections with financial offers to gain control of MCD committees.
